text: Robert Gould Shaw (October 10, 1837 in Boston, Massachusetts â€“ July 18, 1863 in Morris Island, South Carolina) was a colonel during the American Civil War. He led the all African American 54th Massachusetts Infantry Regiment. Shaw died leading his troops attacking Fort Wagner in 1863, aged 25. ==References== Category:1837 births Category:1863 deaths Category:American colonels Category:Military people killed in action Category:Military personnel of the American Civil War Category:People from Boston Category:Military people from Massachusetts
title: Robert Gould Shaw
